meanings.definition: A slang term for hitting or striking something.
meanings.sent1: He gave the door a tonks with his fist.
meanings.sent2: The hammer made a loud tonks against the metal.
meanings.sent3: The cat gave the mouse a playful tonks on the head.
meanings.sent4: The thunderstorm's fury was like a tonks on the roof.
meanings.sent5: The boxer's punch landed with a solid tonks on his opponent's jaw.

meanings.definition: A British slang term for money.
meanings.sent1: She found a tonks of coins in her pocket.
meanings.sent2: He had to work hard to earn enough tonks for the trip.
meanings.sent3: The magician pulled tonks of cash out of his hat.
meanings.sent4: Money can be a powerful tonks in the world.
meanings.sent5: The treasure chest was filled with tonks of gold coins.

meanings.definition: A character in the Harry Potter series.
meanings.sent1: Tonks was a skilled witch and a member of the Order of the Phoenix.
meanings.sent2: Harry Potter admired Tonks for her magical abilities.
meanings.sent3: Tonks' ability to change appearance was always a source of amusement.
meanings.sent4: In the wizarding world, Tonks was like a colorful chameleon.
meanings.sent5: The adventures of Tonks added a touch of magic to the story.
